Key Match Events: Anthony Edwards scored a game-high 33 points and Mike Conley dished out 11 assists as the Minnesota Timberwolves defeated the Chicago Bulls 135-119.
Julius Randle had 22 points and 10 rebounds for the Timberwolves, and Rudy Gobert finished with 21 points and nine boards.
Nikola Vucevic scored 25 points for the Bulls on 11-for-15 shooting.
Coby White had 24 points and eight assists.
Chicago led 95-90 after three quarters, but Minnesota controlled the action in the fourth.
Randle's driving layup lifted the Timberwolves to a 107-106 lead with 6:47 left.
Mike Conley had 14 points and 11 assists for the Timberwolves.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Timberwolves: Minnesota struggled at the start of the game, but its stars got hot at the right time.
Bulls: Went 10 for 17 from three-point range in the first half, but they were five of 19 from deep in the second half.

Trailing 106-101 in the fourth quarter, the Timberwolves rattled off a 12-0 run to take the lead for the first time since the game’s opening minutes. Two Edwards threes gave the Wolves a 113-106 advantage and forced the Bulls to call a timeout.
Minnesota shot 70.8 per cent from the field in the fourth, including six for 11 from three.
